intro: Salicornia ramosissima f. pygmaea, commonly known as dwarf glasswort, is a succulent plant belonging to the Amaranthaceae family. It is characterized by its small, fleshy, salt-tolerant stems and leaves that often appear translucent. This variety is typically found in coastal areas where it thrives in saline and alkaline soils. The plant produces tiny, greenish flowers that bloom in clusters during the summer months. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to stabilize coastal soils.
